column4: I found many mirrors at https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+archivemirrors , how do i get the *real* mirror list?
which country are yo u in?
open system/administration/synaptic package manager
I'm write a tools that to test mirrors speed, then choose fast server add in my /etc/apt/sources.list, so i don't care which country, i just want get a list that contain all those mirrors.
I'm writing package manager, so i want to the mirror list. :)
then on the very first tab,,,"Download from:"  you can choose mirrors from there
unless I am misunderstanding you
I'm not ask how to use or choose those mirrors, i want find a way to get mirror list, then test mirror speed, understand?

I see,, so on that link with mirrors... you can click on any one of them which will then take you to t he appropriate page to insert the deb http for sources list,,,again if I am not misunderstanding...if I am  then I probably cant help
I know that, but i want automatic way, how does Ubuntu administrator generate those mirror list?
I'm looking for no click way, that return mirror list directly.
this may or may not help  its an older post   https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Debmirror
I think  debmirror is what you want but again... I dont know for sure,,,
Ok, thanks, let me check.
are you on gnome3  or ubuntu 11.04?
Gnome-shell with Ubuntu-11.04
ooo   ok...
I binding so many "windows key shortcut" on Emacs, i hate Gnome3 binding "windows key", do you know any way to remove "windows key" ? Since I can use Alt+F1 too.
not that I am aware of  no...
Even hacking way? I guess gnome developer must have some code do those?
or they hard-coding it?
